response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
  i = i + 1;
    names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.
Question: How to get the value of a key in a JSONObject: :I have a JSONObject that has a key called "name" and i want to get the value of that key.
public class JSONParser {
    public static String getName(JSONObject jsonObject) {
        try {
            return jsonObject.getString("name");
        } catch (JSONException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return null;
    }
}

Please using this api: JSONObject.getString("name").
Answer:<<<api>>>: JSONObject.getString("name")
<<<code>>>: JSONObject jsonObject = new JSONObject(jsonString);
String name = jsonObject.getString("name");
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the getString method to get the value of a key in a JSONObject.
